page_analysis.text_content:
Detached 2nd-dwelling units & associated parking site planning

Fig 41 Examples of site planning solutions for detached 2nd dwelling units and associated required parking

A Detached & separate from main-dwelling parking
• Main dwelling has a 1-car attached garage.
• 2nd dwelling has a 1-car detached garage. (Because it is detached and at least 75' from the front lot line, it may be located in the rear and side yards.)
• Both dwellings use driveway for their uncovered spaces (beyond front setback)

B Attached & separate from main-dwelling parking
• Main dwelling has 1-car attached garage.
• 2nd dwelling has a 1-car attached garage. (Because attached, it must be located with the building area rather than in the rear or side yards).
• Both dwellings use driveway for their uncovered spaces (beyond front setback)

C Detached & combined with main-dwelling parking
• Both dwellings share a 2-car detached garage. (Because it is detached and at least 75' from the front lot line, it may be located in the rear and side yards.)
• Both dwellings use the driveway for their respective uncovered spaces (beyond front setback)

D Combined w/ main-dwelling parking that is attached to main dwelling
• Both dwellings share a 2-car attached garage.
• Both dwellings use the driveway for their respective uncovered spaces (beyond front setback)

Key
Curb
Lot line
Sidewalk

Dwelling
2nd-dwelling unit & associated pkg

visual_elements.description:
Four side-by-side interior lot examples illustrating different site planning solutions for detached 2nd dwelling units and associated parking. Each diagram shows a lot layout with labeled areas including 'Rear yard', 'Front yard', 'Interior side yard', 'Main dwelling', 'Detached 2nd dwelling unit 900 sf max', and parking spaces. 

- Diagram A (far left) shows a 1-car detached garage for the 2nd dwelling and a 1-car attached garage for the main dwelling, with a 12' minimum buildable area between buildings and a 3' minimum setback from the interior side yard.
- Diagram B (second from left) shows both the main and 2nd dwelling with 1-car attached garages, with similar 12' minimum buildable area and 3' minimum setback.
- Diagram C (second from right) shows a 2-car detached garage shared by both dwellings, with the same 12' minimum buildable area and 3' minimum setback.
- Diagram D (far right) shows a 2-car attached garage shared by both dwellings, with the 2nd dwelling unit and main dwelling adjacent, and the same 12' minimum buildable area.

Each diagram uses shading and labels to distinguish buildable areas, dwellings, garages, and uncovered spaces. The diagrams are annotated with arrows and measurements indicating setbacks and buildable areas.
visual_elements.location: Middle of the page, spanning horizontally across the page

visual_elements.description: A key explaining symbols used in the diagrams: solid line for curb, dashed line for lot line, shaded pattern for sidewalk, dashed area for required setbacks, light gray shading for dwelling, dark gray shading for 2nd-dwelling unit & associated parking, white area for area that may not be used to satisfy required parking spaces, and a car icon representing uncovered space.
